body: When upgrading Radiance to the latest release **v5.0.a.12**, the **evalglare.exe** is upgraded, too, to **v.1.31** which causes the following error using the Honeybee glare analysis component to read the HDR image: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JkFWP9bD-scPho5472HcH-PTIkmuWsEjrY4JVaVSdvbYLNJqieRVZynV7xO6ZxQu35b0OwlMjFhiUKkLE5L9D5*0QDgOEzKX/Image9.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JkFWP9bD-seEm0cB0s1*RxrlvUV53MpoN72GUNSVRVCrkOpgEEAdEMCrW9s2nFNBGGPOeMWQwbCL8I5WW7J2v8JCFDSWsvfm/Image10.png) Does anybody encounter the same issue? Using Radiance **v5.0.a.11** which includes **Evalglare v.1.17** seems fine. Thanks! - Ji
topic: Evalglare v1.31 in Radiacne v5.0.a.12 is not working with Honeybee glare analysis component

replies.body: Hi Ji, Thank you for letting us know. I [added an issue](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/568) and will get back to you soon.

Noted with many thanks, Mostapha!



- Ji

Ji,

This might be an issue with the installer: [http://www.radiance-online.org/pipermail/radiance-dev/2016-October/...](http://www.radiance-online.org/pipermail/radiance-dev/2016-October/001645.html)

I will keep you posted.

noted with many thanks, Mostapha!



Hope NREL will fix this problem soon.



- Ji
